Real User Complaints

When ServiceM8 Starts Holding You Back

Based on 2024-2025 verified reviews from G2, Capterra, and Trustpilot

Mac/iOS Platform Lock-In

"Only works well on Mac and iOS platforms"

Real user review. If your office uses Windows PCs or your techs have Android phones, ServiceM8 is a poor fit. The platform was designed exclusively for Apple ecosystem.

"Android app is a trimmed-down version lacking key functionalities"

G2 feedback. Android users get second-class treatment with limited features compared to iOS. Your techs with Android devices can't do everything their iOS counterparts can.

✓ Thorbis Cross-Platform Solution

Works identically on Windows, Mac, iOS, Android, and web. All devices get the same features and performance. No platform lock-in.

Extremely Slow Performance

"System extremely slow, cannot complete basic search queries"

Capterra review. CSRs waste 5-10 minutes waiting for searches to complete. Finding a customer or past job should take seconds, not minutes.

"System lags with large customer databases"

User complaint. As your business grows past 1,000+ customers, ServiceM8 slows to a crawl. What worked fine at 200 customers becomes unusable at 2,000.

✓ Thorbis Performance

PostgreSQL full-text search returns results in <100ms even with 50,000+ customers. Composite indexes and query optimization ensure fast performance at any scale.

Basic Scheduling Features

"Scheduling lacks notifications, shift swaps, and conflict detection"

G2 review. ServiceM8's scheduler is bare-bones. No automatic alerts when conflicts arise, no built-in shift swap system, no smart conflict resolution.

"Notifications have pretty much stopped functioning"

Real user complaint. Even basic notifications are unreliable. Techs don't get alerts about schedule changes, leading to missed appointments.

✓ Thorbis Smart Scheduling

Built-in notifications, automated conflict detection, shift swap system, route optimization, and real-time sync. Scheduling that actually works for multi-truck operations.

Poor Cancellation Experience

"Horrible customer service when trying to cancel"

Trustpilot review. Users report being ignored or given the runaround when attempting to cancel subscriptions. What should be simple becomes a multi-week ordeal.

"Per-user pricing becomes expensive quickly"

User feedback. At $39-59/user/month, costs escalate fast. A 10-person team pays $390-590/month before any add-ons or premium features.

✓ Thorbis Transparency

Cancel anytime with one click - no runaround. Flat $200/month pricing with no per-user fees means predictable costs as you grow. Export your data anytime.

Deep Dive

Why Teams Choose Thorbis Over ServiceM8

The features that actually matter for field service businesses

Cross-Platform vs Mac-Only Lock-In
Why ServiceM8's Apple ecosystem limitation hurts your business

The ServiceM8 Platform Problem

  • "Only works well on Mac and iOS platforms"

    Real user review. ServiceM8 was designed exclusively for Apple devices. If your office runs Windows PCs or your techs prefer Android phones, you're fighting the system from day one.

  • "Android app is a trimmed-down version lacking key functionalities"

    G2 feedback. Android users get second-class treatment. Features available on iOS are missing or limited on Android, creating frustration and workflow inconsistencies across your team.

  • "Forces entire company to Apple ecosystem"

    User complaint. Switching to ServiceM8 means buying MacBooks for office staff and iPhones for all techs. That's $50,000-100,000 in hardware costs for a 10-person team.

The Thorbis Cross-Platform Advantage

  • Works on any device - Windows PCs, MacBooks, iPhones, Android phones, iPads, Windows tablets
  • Feature parity across platforms - iOS and Android apps have identical capabilities
  • Use existing hardware - no forced migration to Apple ecosystem
  • Web-based access - works in any browser without installing software
  • Consistent experience - same interface and features regardless of device

Hardware Cost Savings

Avoiding Apple-only lock-in saves $50,000-100,000 in hardware costs for a 10-person team. Your techs can use the Android phones they already own, and office staff can continue with Windows PCs. That's real money saved vs being forced into ServiceM8's ecosystem.

Migration Guide

Your 30-Day Migration from ServiceM8 to Thorbis

Structured plan for zero-downtime transition

Data migration
Thorbis handles export/import of ServiceM8 customers, job history, and products.
  • Export data via ServiceM8 reports.
  • Thorbis cleans, deduplicates, and transforms for new workflows.
  • Validation ensures reporting parity before cutover.
Workflow optimization
Replace manual processes with automated booking, dispatch, and invoicing flows.
  • Configure AI assistant, online booking, and customer portal.
  • Build templates for estimates, invoices, and checklists.
  • Launch automated nurture campaigns for repeat visits.
Adoption support
Role-based training and office hours keep teams confident during transition.
  • Live dispatcher training and scenario planning.
  • Technician mobile app onboarding with offline best practices.
  • Weekly office hours during the first month.
